translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Tuvara
the best of men, Siddhattha, had passed away,
I received a portion of his relics,
of the one with two feet, the Tathāgata.
of the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun,
I worshipped it for five years,
as if worshipping the best of men, while he was still present.
I did not fall into the lower realms,🔽because of the fruit of worshipping the relic,
of the one with two feet, the Tathāgata.
I have done what needed be done for the Teaching of the Buddha.”🔽Thus the Elder Dhātupūjaka spoke these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dhātupūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Dhātupūjakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
